Afterward, extrude the 3D sketch through the sketch plane by 0.2946 units in the positive direction normal to the sketch plane to create a 3D solid body. This operation results in a new body. Part 2: Construct a Three-Dimensional, Rectangular Prism with a Curved Top Edge Construct a new coordinate system with the following orientation and location: * Euler Angles: 0.0, 0.0, -90.0 * Translation Vector: 0.0643, 0.0, 0.1071 Create a 2D sketch on face 1 of the coordinate system with the following components: * Loop 1: + Arc 1: Start Point (0.0, 0.1875), Mid Point (0.3089, 0.0), End Point (0.6178, 0.1875) + Line 1: Start Point (0.6178, 0.1875), End Point (0.0, 0.1875) Note that this sketch consists of one loop with two curves: one arc and one line. With the sketch complete, scale it by a factor of 0.6178, then transform it into a 3D sketch using the current coordinate system. Afterwards, extrude the 3D sketch through the sketch plane by 0.3857 units in the opposite direction normal to the sketch plane to remove material (cut) from the existing solid body. This operation results in a curved, rectangular prism with flat, parallel bottom and top surfaces.</description>

The following steps will guide you in creating the 2D sketch, scaling, transforming it into 3D, and extruding it to create the final 3D model for this part. 1. **Create the 2D Sketch** - Begin by creating a new coordinate system with euler angles [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] and a translation vector of [0.0, 0.0, 0.0]. - Create a face on the XY plane of the coordinate system. - Draw the first loop with 4 line segments defined by the following start and end points: - Line 1: [0.0, 0.0] to [0.75, 0.0] - Line 2: [0.75, 0.0] to [0.75, 0.75] - Line 3: [0.75, 0.75] to [0.0, 0.75] - Line 4: [0.0, 0.75] to [0.0, 0.0] - Draw the second loop with 4 line segments defined by the following start and end points: - Line 1: [0.0375, 0.0375] to [0.7125, 0.0375] - Line 2: [0.7125, 0.0375] to [0.7125, 0.7125] - Line 3: [0.7125, 0.7125] to [0.0375, 0.7125] - Line 4: [0.0375, 0.7125] to [0.0375, 0.0375] 2. **Scale the 2D Sketch** - Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.75. 3. **Transform the 2D Sketch into 3D** - Transform the scaled 2D sketch into 3D using the euler angles and translation vector defined in the coordinate system. 4. **Extrude the 2D Sketch to Generate the 3D Model** - Extrude the 2D sketch by 0.075 units along the normal of the sketch. After following these instructions, you will have created the first part of the assembly: a rectangular prism with the following dimensions: - Length: 0.75 units - Width: 0.75 units - Height: 0.075 units</description>
